column4: I know that I followed some directions I found in some forums (many of them and none has worked so far)
jimmey, I am a newbie, and I don't really know what I am doing
I know it was working in suse
lol jima21742
that would be nice
as I want these nice effects (wobbly windows etc)
I am on vesa now
jimmey, I did that yesterday... and it didn't work, so as suggested, I followed the instructions for edgy, and the same result, always had to reconfigure xserver back to vesa to get it back
what is that red horizontal line that shows up every now and again in here?
jima, I have no idea how to help you
Heh, it could be worse - Like not being able to boot at all...
Ha, ha. Same fear here.
Yea, sticks out from the crowd.
I hope not. I'v been trying to get Linux back up for almost 2 days straight now.
Yea, I even had the chance to cry a few times - Actually cry.
Yea - now compare that to not even being able to boot - and for no apparent reason - and then imagine me crying - you get the picture.

Well, you see, I can actually boot from live cd and then mount the partition that I have been using, so it has to be something that I can do without just trashing all my settings. I really don't want to go back to windows - I made a promise.
I'm crying right now.
It's not that grub can't find the partition, it's not filesystem corruption, it's not messed up menu.lst - It's just that ubuntu get's stuck at "Mounting filessytem" - I AM GOING INSANE
It's not the CD - I installed ubuntu more than 6 months ago, it's been working fine, so that live cd is fine.
Later.
